description: Back-formation from pedlar. (Compare burgle from burglar.)

verbs.description: peddle (third-person singular simple present peddles, present participle peddling, simple past and past participle peddled)

entries.meaning: To sell things, especially door to door or in insignificant quantities.
(derogatory, figuratively) To spread or cause to spread.
examples: Christine walked a dangerous line, peddling gossip about her detested son-in-law.
